page.title: 09HARVEST FESTIVALS IN BRAILES
page.content: Harvest Time is still widely celebrated in the village.Traditional Thanksgiving Services are held in the three churches with the emphasis,as of old,being placed on the harvest of the land.A large congregation gathers annually in the beautifully decorated St.George's Church and the 'Cathedral of the Feldon' rings with joyful harvest hymns. Other harvest services are held at the Church of England Primary School, the Feldon Club and the Geeorge Hotel. It is customary for the produce to be auctioned after the services and the proceeds donated to charity The climax of the harvest season is a gathering of all denominations at the Harvest Supper in the Village Hall with food prepared by the ladies and homespun entertainment organised by the vicar.
